meanings.definition: creeshes (verb): to make a harsh, grating sound
meanings.sent1: The old door creeshes when it swings open.
meanings.sent2: The rusty gate creeshes loudly in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The haunted house creeshes eerily at midnight.
meanings.sent4: The car brakes creeshes like a banshee in the night.
meanings.sent5: The metal chair creeshes against the floor, echoing through the room.

meanings.sent1: The creeshes of the chalk on the blackboard were unbearable.
meanings.sent2: The creeshes of the rusty hinges filled the room.
meanings.sent3: The creeshes of the old violin strings sounded like a cat in distress.
meanings.sent4: The creeshes of the train brakes pierced through the silence.
meanings.sent5: The creeshes of the metal scraping against metal made my teeth ache.

meanings.definition: creeshes (adjective): harsh or grating in sound
meanings.sent1: The creeshes sound of the thunder made me jump.
meanings.sent2: The creeshes wind outside rattled the windows.
meanings.sent3: The creeshes voice of the witch sent shivers down my spine.
meanings.sent4: The creeshes laughter of the villain echoed in the night.
meanings.sent5: The creeshes sound of the alarm clock woke me abruptly.
